prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.A.1? 

###
completion: System.out.print and System.out. println display information on the computer monitor. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.A.2? 

###
completion: System.out.println moves the cursor to a new line after the information has been displayed, while System.out.print does not. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.A.1? 

###
completion: A string literal is enclosed in double quotes. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.B.1? 

###
completion: A type is a set of values (a domain) and a set of operations on them. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.B.2? 

###
completion: Data types can be categorized as either primitive or reference. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.B.3? 

###
completion: The primitive data types used in this course define the set of operations for numbers and Boolean values. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.C.1? 

###
completion: The three primitive data types used in this course are int, double, and boolean. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.C.2? 

###
completion: Each variable has associated memory that is used to hold its value. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.C.3? 

###
completion: The memory associated with a variable of a primitive type holds an actual primitive value. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.C.4? 

###
completion: When a variable is declared final, its value cannot be changed once it is initialized. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.1? 

###
completion: A literal is the source code representation of a fixed value. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.2? 

###
completion: Arithmetic expressions include expressions of type int and double. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.3? 

###
completion: The arithmetic operators consist of +, -, *, /, and %. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.4? 

###
completion: An arithmetic operation that uses two int values will evaluate to an int value. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.5? 

###
completion: An arithmetic operation that uses a double value will evaluate to a double value. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.6? 

###
completion: Operators can be used to construct compound expressions. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.7? 

###
completion: During evaluation, operands are associated with operators according to operator precedence to determine how they are grouped. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.A.8? 

###
completion: An attempt to divide an integer by zero will result in an ArithmeticException to occur. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.B.1? 

###
completion: The assignment operator (=) allows a program to initialize or change the value stored in a variable. The value of the expression on the right is stored in the variable on the left. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.B.2? 

###
completion: During execution, expressions are evaluated to produce a single value. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.B.3? 

###
completion: The value of an expression has a type based on the evaluation of the expression. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.B.4? 

###
completion: Compound assignment operators (+=, -=, *=, /=, %=) can be used in place of the assignment operator. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.B.5? 

###
completion: The increment operator (++) and decrement operator (--) are used to add 1 or subtract 1 from the stored value of a variable or an array element. The new value is assigned to the variable or array element. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.C.1? 

###
completion: The casting operators (int) and (double) can be used to create a temporary value converted to a different data type. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.C.2? 

###
completion: Casting a double value to an int causes the digits to the right of the decimal point to be truncated. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.C.3? 

###
completion: Some programming code causes int values to be automatically cast (widened) to double values. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.C.4? 

###
completion: Values of type double can be rounded to the nearest integer by (int)(x + 0.5) or (int)(x - 0.5) for negative numbers. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.C.5? 

###
completion: Integer values in Java are represented by values of type int, which are stored using a finite amount (4 bytes) of memory. Therefore, an int value must be in the range from Integer.MIN_VALUE to Integer.MAX_ VALUE inclusive. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.C.6? 

###
completion: If an expression would evaluate to an int value outside of the allowed range, an integer overflow occurs. This could result in an incorrect value within the allowed range. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.B.1? 

###
completion: An object is a specific instance of a class with defined attributes. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.B.2? 

###
completion: A class is the formal implementation, or blueprint, of the attributes and behaviors of an object. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.C.1? 

###
completion: A signature consists of the constructor name and the parameter list. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.C.2? 

###
completion: The parameter list, in the header of a constructor, lists the types of the values that are passed and their variable names. These are often referred to as formal parameters. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.C.3? 

###
completion: A parameter is a value that is passed into a constructor. These are often referred to as actual parameters. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.C.4? 

###
completion: Constructors are said to be overloaded when there are multiple constructors with the same name but a different signature. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.C.5? 

###
completion: The actual parameters passed to a constructor must be compatible with the types identified in the formal parameter list. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.C.6? 

###
completion: Parameters are passed using call by value. Call by value initializes the formal parameters with copies of the actual parameters. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.D.1? 

###
completion: Every object is created using the keyword new followed by a call to one of the class's constructors. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.D.2? 

###
completion: A class contains constructors that are invoked to create objects. They have the same name as the class. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.D.3? 

###
completion: Existing classes and class libraries can be utilized as appropriate to create objects. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.D.4? 

###
completion: Parameters allow values to be passed to the constructor to establish the initial state of the object. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.D.1? 

###
completion: The keyword null is a special value used to indicate that a reference is not associated with any object. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.D.2? 

###
completion: The memory associated with a variable of a reference type holds an object reference value or, if there is no object, null. This value is the memory address of the referenced object. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.1? 

###
completion: An object's behavior refers to what the object can do (or what can be done to it) and is defined by methods. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.2? 

###
completion: Procedural abstraction allows a programmer to use a method by knowing what the method does even if they do not know how the method was written. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.3? 

###
completion: A method signature for a method without parameters consists of the method name and an empty parameter list. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.4? 

###
completion: A method or constructor call interrupts the sequential execution of statements, causing the program to first execute the statements in the method or constructor before continuing. Once the last statement in the method or constructor has executed or a return statement is executed, flow of control is returned to the point immediately following where the method or constructor was called. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.5? 

###
completion: Non-static methods are called through objects of the class. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.6? 

###
completion: The dot operator is used along with the object name to call non-static methods. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.7? 

###
completion: Void Methods do not have return values and are therefore not called as part of an expression. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.E.8? 

###
completion: Using a null reference to call a method or access an instance variable causes a NullPointerException to be thrown. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.F.1? 

###
completion: A method signature for a method with parameters consists of the method name and the ordered list of parameter types. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.F.2? 

###
completion: Values provided in the parameter list need to correspond to the order and type in the method signature. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.F.3? 

###
completion: Methods are said to be overloaded when there are multiple methods with the same name but a different signature. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.G.1? 

###
completion: Non-Void Methods return a value that is the same type as the return type in the signature. To use the return value when calling a non-void method, it must be stored in a variable or used as part of an expression. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.1? 

###
completion: String objects can be created by using string literals or by calling the String class constructor. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.2? 

###
completion: String objects are immutable, meaning that String methods do not change the String object. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.3? 

###
completion: String objects can be concatenated using the + or += operator, resulting in a new String object. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.4? 

###
completion: Primitive values can be concatenated with a String object. This causes implicit conversion of the values to String objects. ###

prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.5? 

###
completion: Escape sequences start with a \ and have a special meaning in Java. Escape sequences used in this course include \

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.6? 

###
completion.completion: Application program interfaces (APIs) and libraries simplify complex programming tasks. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.7? 

###
completion.completion: Documentation for APIs and libraries are essential to understanding the attributes and behaviors of an object of a class. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.8? 

###
completion.completion: Classes in the APIs and libraries are grouped into packages. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.9? 

###
completion.completion: The String class is part of the java.lang package. Classes in the java.lang package are available by default. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.10? 

###
completion.completion: A String object has index values from 0 to length - 1. Attempting to access indices outside this range will result in an StringIndexOutOfBoundsException. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.11? 

###
completion.completion: A String object can be concatenated with an object reference, which implicitly calls the referenced object's toString method. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.12? 

###
completion.completion: The following String methods and constructors-including what they do and when they are used-are part of the Java Quick Reference: § String(String str) - Constructs a new String object that represents the same sequence of characters as str § int length()- Returns the number of characters in a String object § String substring(int from, int to)- Returns the substring beginning at index from and ending at index to - 1 § String substring(int from) - Returns substring(from, length()) § int indexOf(String str) - Returns the index of the first occurrence of str; returns -1 if not found § boolean equals(String other) - Returns true if this is equal to other; returns false otherwise § int compareTo(String other) - Returns a value < 0 if this is less than other; returns zero if this is equal to other; returns a value > 0 if this is greater than other ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.E.13? 

###
completion.completion: A string identical to the single element substring at position index can be created by calling substring(index, index + 1). ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.1? 

###
completion.completion: The Integer class and Double class are part of the java.lang package. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.2? 

###
completion.completion:
The following Integer methods and constructors-including what they do and when they are used-are part of the Java Quick Reference:
§ Integer(int value) - Constructs a new Integer object that represents the specified int value
§ Integer.MIN_VALUE- The minimum value represented by an int or Integer
§ Integer.MAX_VALUE- The maximum value represented by an int or Integer
§ int intValue()- Returns the value of this Integer as an in§t
 ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.3? 

###
completion.completion:
The following Double methods and constructors-including what they do and when they are used-are part of the Java Quick
§ Double(double value) - Constructs a new Double object that represents the specified double value
§ double doubleValue()- Returns the value of this Double as a double ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.4? 

###
completion.completion: Autoboxing is the automatic conversion that the Java compiler makes between primitive types and their corresponding object wrapper classes. This includes converting an int to an Integer and a double to a Double. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.5? 

###
completion.completion:
The Java compiler applies autoboxing when a primitive value is: 
* Passed as a parameter to a method that expects an object of the corresponding wrapper class 
* Assigned to a variable of the corresponding wrapper class. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.6? 

###
completion.completion: Unboxing is the automatic conversion that the Java compiler makes from the wrapper class to the primitive type. This includes converting an Integer to an int and a Double to a double. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard VAR-1.F.7? 

###
completion.completion: The Java compiler applies unboxing when a wrapper class object is: * Passed as a parameter to a method that expects a value of the corresponding primitive type. * Assigned to a variable of the corresponding primitive type. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-1.H.1? 

###
completion.completion: Static methods are called using the dot operator along with the class name unless they are defined in the enclosing class. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.D.1? 

###
completion.completion: The Math class is part of the java.lang package. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.D.2? 

###
completion.completion: The Math class contains only static methods. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.D.3? 

###
completion.completion:
The following static Math methods-including what they do and when they are used-are part of the Java Quick Reference:
§ int abs(int x) - Returns the absolute value of an int value
§ double abs(double x) - Returns the absolute value of a double value
§ double pow(double base, double exponent) - Returns the value of the first parameter raised to the power of the second parameter
§ double sqrt(double x) - Returns the positive square root of a double value
§ double random()- Returns a double value greater than or equal to 0.0 and less than 1.0 ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.D.4? 

###
completion.completion: The values returned from Math.random can be manipulated to produce a random int or double in a defined range. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.E.1? 

###
completion.completion: Primitive values and reference values can be compared using relational operators (i.e., == and !=). ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.E.2? 

###
completion.completion: Arithmetic expression values can be compared using relational operators (i.e., <, >, <=, >=). ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.E.3? 

###
completion.completion: An expression involving relational operators evaluates to a Boolean value. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.A.1? 

###
completion.completion: Conditional statements interrupt the sequential execution of statements. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.A.2? 

###
completion.completion: if statements affect the flow of control by executing different statements based on the value of a Boolean expression. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.A.3? 

###
completion.completion: A one-way selection (if statement) is written when there is a set of statements to execute under a certain condition. In this case, the body is executed only when the Boolean condition is true ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.A.4? 

###
completion.completion: A two-way selection is written when there are two sets of statements- one to be executed when the Boolean condition is true, and another set for when the Boolean condition is false. In this case, the body of the
is executed when the Boolean condition is true, and the body of the
is executed when the Boolean condition is false. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.A.5? 

###
completion.completion: A multi-way selection is written when there are a series of conditions with different statements for each condition. Multi-way selection is performed using if-else-if statements such that exactly one section of code is executed based on the first condition that evaluates to true. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.B.1? 

###
completion.completion: Nested if statements consist of if statements within if statements. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.F.1? 

###
completion.completion: Logical operators !(not), &&(and), and ||(or) are used with Boolean values. This represents the order these operators will be evaluated. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.F.2? 

###
completion.completion: An expression involving logical operators evaluates to a Boolean value. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.F.3? 

###
completion.completion: When the result of a logical expression using && or || can be determined by evaluating only the first Boolean operand, the second is not evaluated. This is known as short-circuited evaluation. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.G.1? 

###
completion.completion: De Morgan's Laws can be applied to Boolean expressions. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.G.2? 

###
completion.completion: Truth tables can be used to prove Boolean identities. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.G.3? 

###
completion.completion: Equivalent Boolean expressions will evaluate to the same value in all cases. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.H.1? 

###
completion.completion: Two object references are considered aliases when they both reference the same object. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.H.2? 

###
completion.completion: Object reference values can be compared, using == and !=, to identify aliases. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.H.3? 

###
completion.completion: A reference value can be compared with null, using == or !=, to determine if the reference actually references an object. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-1.H.4? 

###
completion.completion: Often classes have their own equals method, which can be used to determine whether two objects of the class are equivalent. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.C.1? 

###
completion.completion: Iteration statements change the flow of control by repeating a set of statements zero or more times until a condition is met. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.C.2? 

###
completion.completion: In loops, the Boolean expression is evaluated before each iteration of the loop body, including the first. When the expression evaluates to true, the loop body is executed. This continues until the expression evaluates to false, whereupon the iteration ceases. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.C.3? 

###
completion.completion: A loop is an infinite loop when the Boolean expression always evaluates to true. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.C.4? 

###
completion.completion: If the Boolean expression evaluates to false initially, the loop body is not executed at all. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.C.5? 

###
completion.completion: Executing a return statement inside an iteration statement will halt the loop and exit the method or constructor. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.D.1? 

###
completion.completion:
There are standard algorithms to:
§ Identify if an integer is or is not evenly divisible by another integer
§ Identify the individual digits in an integer
§ Determine the frequency with which a specific criterion is met ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.D.2? 

###
completion.completion:
There are standard algorithms to:
§ Determine a minimum or maximum value 
§ Compute a sum, average, or mode ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.E.1? 

###
completion.completion: There are three parts in a for loop header: the initialization, the Boolean expression, and the increment. The increment statement can also be a decrement statement. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.E.2? 

###
completion.completion: In a for loop, the initialization statement is only executed once before the first Boolean expression evaluation. The variable being initialized is referred to as a loop control variable. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.E.3? 

###
completion.completion: In each iteration of a for loop, the increment statement is executed after the entire loop body is executed and before the Boolean expression is evaluated again. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.E.4? 

###
completion.completion: A for loop can be rewritten into an equivalent while loop and vice versa. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.E.5? 

###
completion.completion: errors occur when the iteration statement loops one time too many or one time too few. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.F.1? 

###
completion.completion:
There are standard algorithms that utilize String traversals to:
§ Find if one or more substrings has a particular property
§ Determine the number of substrings that meet specific criteria
§ Create a new string with the characters reversed ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.G.1? 

###
completion.completion: Nested iteration statements are iteration statements that appear in the body of another iteration statement. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.G.2? 

###
completion.completion: When a loop is nested inside another loop, the inner loop must complete all its iterations before the outer loop can continue. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.H.1? 

###
completion.completion: A statement execution count indicates the number of times a statement is executed by the program. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.A.1? 

###
completion.completion: The keywords public and private affect the access of classes, data, constructors, and methods. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.A.2? 

###
completion.completion: The keyword private restricts access to the declaring class, while the keyword public allows access from classes outside the declaring class. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.A.3? 

###
completion.completion: Classes are designated public. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.A.4? 

###
completion.completion: Access to attributes should be kept internal to the class. Therefore, instance variables are designated as private. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.A.5? 

###
completion.completion: Constructors are designated public. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.A.6? 

###
completion.completion: Access to behaviors can be internal or external to the class. Therefore, methods can be designated as either public or private. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-3.A.1? 

###
completion.completion: Data encapsulation is a technique in which the implementation details of a class are kept hidden from the user. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-3.A.2? 

###
completion.completion: When designing a class, programmers make decisions about what data to make accessible and modifiable from an external class. Data can be either accessible or modifiable, or it can be both or neither. ###

completion.completion: Constructor parameters are local variables to the constructor and provide data to initialize instance variables. ###

###
completion.completion: When a mutable object is a constructor parameter, the instance variable should be initialized with a copy of the referenced object. In this way, the instance variable is not an alias of the original object, and methods are prevented from modifying the state of the original object. ###

completion.completion: When no constructor is written, Java provides a no-argument constructor, and the instance variables are set to default values. ###

completion.completion: Comments are ignored by the compiler and are not executed when the program is run. ###

completion.completion:
Three types of comments in Java include

###
completion.completion: A precondition is a condition that must be true just prior to the execution of a section of program code in order for the method to behave as expected. There is no expectation that the method will check to ensure preconditions are satisfied. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.C.4? 

###
completion.completion: A postcondition is a condition that must always be true after the execution of a section of program code. Postconditions describe the outcome of the execution in terms of what is being returned or the state of an object. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard MOD-2.C.5? 

###
completion.completion: Programmers write method code to satisfy the postconditions when preconditions are met. ###

completion.completion: An accessor method allows other objects to obtain the value of instance variables or static variables. ###

completion.completion: In non-Void Methods, a return expression compatible with the return type is evaluated, and a copy of that value is returned. This is referred to as

completion.completion: The ArrayList class is part of the java. util package. An import statement can be used to make this class available for use in the program. ###

###
completion.completion:
The following ArrayList methods- including what they do and when they are used-are part of the Java Quick Reference:
§ int size()-Returnsthenumberof elements in the list
§ boolean add(E obj)-Appends obj to end of list; returns true
§ void add(int index, E obj)- Inserts obj at position index (0 <= index <= size), moving elements at position index and higher to the right (adds 1 to their indices) and adds 1 to size
§ E get(int index)-Returns the element at position index in the list
§ E set(int index, E obj)-  Replaces the element at position index with obj; returns the element formerly at position index
§ E remove(int index)-Removes element from position index, moving elements at position index + 1 and higher to the left (subtracts 1 from their indices) and subtracts 1 from size; returns the element formerly at position index ###

completion.completion: Deleting elements during a traversal of an ArrayList requires using special techniques to avoid skipping elements. ###

completion.completion: refers to an ordering of 2D array elements where traversal occurs across each row, while

completion.completion: Nested iteration statements can be written to traverse the 2D array in
or

completion.completion: The outer loop of a nested enhanced for loop used to traverse a 2D array traverses the rows. Therefore, the enhanced for loop variable must be the type of each row, which is a 1D array. The inner loop traverses a single row. completion.prompt:

completion.completion: Classes that extend a superclass, called subclasses, can draw upon the existing attributes and behaviors of the superclass without repeating these in the code. ###

completion.completion: Extending a subclass from a superclass creates an

completion.completion: The keyword extends is used to establish an inheritance relationship between a subclass and a superclass. A class can extend onlyone superclass. ###

completion.completion: Constructors are not inherited. ###

completion.completion: The actual parameters passed in the call to the superclass constructor provide values that the constructor can use to initialize the object's instance variables. ###

completion.completion: When a subclass's constructor does not explicitly call a superclass's constructor using super, Java inserts a call to the superclass's no-argument constructor. ###

completion.prompt:

completion.completion: Regardless of whether the superclass constructor is called implicitly or explicitly, the process of calling superclass constructors continues until the Object constructor is called. completion.completion: Any method that is called must be defined within its own class or its superclass. ###

completion.completion: A subclass is usually designed to have modified (overridden) or additional methods or instance variables. ###

completion.completion: Subclasses of Object often override the equals and toString methods with class- specific implementations. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.O.1? 

###
completion.completion: A recursive method is a method that calls itself. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.O.2? 

###
completion.completion: Recursive methods contain at least one base case, which halts the recursion, and at least one recursive call. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.O.3? 

###
completion.completion: Each recursive call has its own set of local variables, including the formal parameters. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.O.4? 

###
completion.completion: Parameter values capture the progress of a recursive process, much like loop control variable values capture the progress of a loop. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.O.5? 

###
completion.completion: Any recursive solution can be replicated through the use of an iterative approach.X EXCLUSION STATEMENT-(EK CON-2.O.5): Writing recursive program code is outside the scope of the course and AP Exam. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.O.6? 

###
completion.completion: Recursion can be used to traverse String, array, and ArrayList objects. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.P.1? 

###
completion.completion: Data must be in sorted order to use the binary search algorithm. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.P.2? 

###
completion.completion: The binary search algorithm starts at the middle of a sorted array or ArrayList and eliminates half of the array or ArrayList in each iteration until the desired value is found or all elements have been eliminated. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.P.3? 

###
completion.completion: Binary search can be more efficient than sequential/linear search.X EXCLUSION STATEMENT-(EK CON-2.P.3): Search algorithms other than sequential/linear and binary search are outside the scope of the course and AP Exam. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.P.4? 

###
completion.completion: The binary search algorithm can be written either iteratively or recursively. ###

completion.prompt:
In AP Computer Science A, what is the College Board Essential Knowledge standard CON-2.Q.1? 

###
completion.completion: Merge sort is a recursive sorting algorithm that can be used to sort elements in an array or ArrayList. ###
